review: I have a old LCD tv and did not have any way to connect my Samsung Note 2 with the TV. At the price point, Google Chromecast is a boon. Easy to set up and can connect to the TV's USB port for power - no dangling cables.Upside - Online content or content from Google playstore can be played directly on the large screen TV. Basically, I don't need to buy a TV with internet connectivity anymore.Downside - Does not have apps that plays content / media directly from the phone. Cannot replicate the screen on the TV, so you cannot play games on the large screen. I hope Google addresses both these items soon.At the price point, I don't see why anyone will go for an apple TV.
author: Mitesh Kumar

review: A very simple device, it was easy to set up and get running. My wife who is not particularly tech savvy was able to figure out how to stream Netflix from her phone to the TV using the Chromecast with absolutely no directions from me, which made me happy.My only complaint is that I wish it had 5 GHz networking since I live in an apartment with a lot of 2.4 GHz wireless networks, but I have not had any issues with streaming performance over 2.4 GHz yet. I've had it for about a month now and it has been working great. Sometimes takes a while to start playing, but once it starts I have never had it buffer or stutter on playback.For the low price I am very pleased. Stop thinking about it and just buy one.
